Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  Sibelius 6 is a giant leap forward in notation software - with amazing  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  new features and improvements for educators, students, composers,       Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  Improvements in Sibelius 6.2                                            Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº                                                                          Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  Sibelius 6.2 contains a number of improvements and fixes, including:    Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº                                                                          Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * Sibelius is now a multi-lingual application, with all six supported   Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    languages inside the same installer. Sibelius will automatically run  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    in the language of your existing serial number, or in the language    Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    of your operating system. To change the language that Sibelius runs   Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    in, use the new Language page of Preferences.                         Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * New option Truncate notes at end of bars when using Edit > Repeat on  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    the Note Input page of Preferences, switched off by default. When     Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    switched on, this option restores the behavior of Edit > Repeat from  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    Sibelius 5, whereby repeating a note when not in note input mode      Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    (i.e. no caret is visible) that is longer than the remainder of the   Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    bar truncates the value of the new note to the length of the bar,     Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    rather than tying it into the next bar.                               Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * A number of new chord symbol types have been added to the default     Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    library of chord symbols, including: major 7 chords with sharp 9ths,  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    sharp 4ths and sharp 5ths; major 7/9/11/13 chords with two            Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    alterations; "add11" chords; "7 b5" and "7b9" chords; and more        Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    besides.                                                              Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * New Hyphens allowed to disappear when syllables are too close         Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    together option on the Text page of House Style > Engraving Rules,    Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    switched on in both new scores and existing scores.                   Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * Sibelius 6 now correctly recognizes Kontakt 4 as a Kontakt-type       Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    device, allowing it to load sounds automatically, provided a          Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    suitable sound set is available.                                      Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * Sibelius now offers to change the staff and/or page size when you     Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    add or remove instruments from your score. It also now intelligently  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    determines a suitable combination of page and staff size when         Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    importing MIDI and PhotoScore/AudioScore files, to try and ensure a   Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    good vertical layout at all times.                                    Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * Sibelius for Mac is now supplied with OpenType versions of the Opus,  Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    Inkpen2, Reprise and Helsinki font families. These fonts provide      Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    improved compatibility with Mac OS X 10.6 Snow Leopard.               Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº  * Sibelius now supports the embedding of OpenType fonts in exported     Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº    EPS files.                                                            Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Âº
